newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends up on funds, grain up on CBOT corn.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends up on funds, grain up on CBOT corn.

text.p: WCE canola ended up on fund buying while feed grain futures rose on an upward surge in CBOT corn futures, traders said.

"Funds bought 1,500 to 2,000 March and some May, crushers bought some May and it enticed some hedges and commission profit taking," a trader said. March canola futures crush margin rose to -22.45 from -23.52 Monday based on CBOT soyoil and meal. March-May spread at $1.30, May-Nov $39, Sep-Nov $5.50, Mar-July $1.60 and May-July $1. Volume was 6,000 lots.
Japan bought 1,000 tonnes canola overnight, sources said.
March canola rose $6 to $413.10, May up $6 to $411.90. May flax rose $3.10 to $349 on commercial demand. Volume was 200.

February western barley rose $1.70 to $137.50 on CBOT corn and Friday's USDA Cattle on Feed Report, traders said, adding Cargill was a key buyer in barley. March rose $1.30 to $136. Feb-May spread $1. Volume was 850.
March feed wheat rose $1.40 to $166.10 on commercials, May climbed $1.50 to $164 on commission houses buying from Alberta Wheat Pool, traders said. Volume was 510 lots.
Oats did not trade. RBC-DS bid for feed peas, floor sources said.
(Values in Canadian dollars/tonne except oats and peas.)
